result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph B. Hodge

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for plea/sentencing 11/28 @ 10:30 am.

1:15 PM . Defendant Joseph B Hodge in court.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Joseph B Hodge.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.
on Request to Appear Remotely

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Jacob Ruetten, unless placed in contact by their correctional setting.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Bail/bond hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:25 PM Defendant Joseph B Hodge appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Joseph B Hodge.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Plank makes motion to modify bond.  State opposes any bond condition modifications gives reasons. Attorney Plank responds. Court denies motion to modify bond, bond remains as set.

Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

Waiver of Prelim on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

3:05 PM Defendant Joseph B Hodge appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Joseph B Hodge.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Set for Waiver of Prelim and ARGN set  for 10/24 @ 1:30pm.

Bail/bond hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bond Adjustment Hearing

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

10:31 AM Defendant Joseph B Hodge appeared by video, in custody from JCJ  Attorney Lucas Swank in court for Joseph B Hodge.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in victim rights compliance and can proceed. Defense requesting lower cash bond. State objects. Court orders bond reduced to $1500.00 cash with same conditions.

3:45 p.m. Spoke with District Attorney's Office and they made contact with the victim. They are okay with the hearing taking place on 9/15/22 and are choosing not to attend. They requested the DA's Office advise them of the outcome of the hearing.  Hearing to be left as is.

Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Hearing sent to Defendant via internal mail to Jackson County Jail

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:02 AM Defendant Joseph B Hodge appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Carly Sebion appear specially for Bryant S Plank in court for Joseph B Hodge.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders that Bond remains as set.  Atty Sebion asks for expedited dates for the PTC and STC.  STC 9/26. Atty Plank can reach out to DA's office for a sooner PTC.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
